content.description:
Start with your left hand where the stand start left-heel is placed and your right hand approximately a foot below the stand starts' right hand placement.

The perceived difficulty of this problem (& stand start) may vary widely due to height and wingspan.

Start as low as you can on both aretes. This climb gets much harder the smaller your wingspan is. Those with a span below 5'8" may not be able to reach the start holds. Thrutchy and flexible compression leads to a pleasant seam crimp and a relaxed topout. Try not to dab on the rock to the left.

I couldn't find any information on this boulder, and it has certainly gotten much easier to access with the new trail. If you have any additional info on name or first ascentionist, please share.
content.location: It is easiest to get to this problem from the Tunnel 1 Trailhead. Head down the creek for about 5 minutes, and there will be a large, horizontal boulder on your left. Just across the path and at the base of the gully is this boulder.
